items.concentration_determination_method: Bradford method (Bradford, 1976) using bovine serum albumin as a standard.
items.formulation: Purified enzyme, stored in TEA–HCl buffer (10 mmol/L, pH 7.5) at -20°C, or lyophilized and stored at -20°C. For activity assays, enzyme was dissolved in buffer. For stability studies, enzyme was also stored with 50% (v/v) glycerol or as lyophilized powder.
items.harvesting_method: Expression in E. coli BL21(DE3), cell disruption as described previously (Kulig et al., 2012), followed by purification using size exclusion chromatography (SEC) for desalting, anion exchange chromatography, and a second SEC for buffer exchange and CaCl2 adjustment.
items.special_treatment: Addition of CaCl2 (0.2–0.8 mmol/L) during purification and storage for stabilization. For activity and stability studies, 0.8 mmol/L CaCl2 was added to all buffers. Lyophilized enzyme required reactivation by equilibration in buffer for several hours before use. Enzyme purity was about 90% by SDS–PAGE. Native molecular weight determined by SEC (trimeric, ~75 kDa).
